resources.title: Free Legal Aid Clinic (FLAC)
resources.description: Provides legal assistance in family and elder law to low-income and elderly residents of Wayne County. Operated by Wayne State University Law School students under attorney supervision.

resources.title: Legal Aid and Defender Association (LAD)
resources.description: Offers free civil legal services to low- and moderate-income residents of Macomb, Oakland, and Wayne counties. Services include family law, housing, and public benefits.

resources.title: Lakeshore Legal Aid
resources.description: Provides free civil legal services to low-income individuals, older adults, and survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault in Southeast Michigan.

resources.title: William Booth Legal Aid Clinic
resources.description: Offers free legal aid to low-income individuals and families in Detroit, focusing on family law, domestic violence, and immigration issues.

resources.title: Michigan Legal Services
resources.description: Provides free representation in housing, public benefits, and community economic development matters to low-income people in Wayne County.

resources.title: Detroit Legal Services Clinic
resources.description: Offers information and advice from volunteer attorneys in areas such as divorce, child support, domestic relations, expungements, and more.

resources.title: Legal Self-Help Center of Wayne County
resources.description: Provides free assistance with simple legal problems, including access to self-help tools and referrals on MichiganLegalHelp.org.

resources.title: Civil Rights Litigation Initiative (CRLI)
resources.description: Offers students the opportunity to work on important civil rights cases in a clinical setting, focusing on issues like racial justice, police misconduct, and voting rights.

resources.title: Michigan Poverty Law Program (MPLP)
resources.description: Works to advance the health, safety, and economic security of low-income Michiganders and advance racial justice through systemic advocacy.

resources.title: Black Women Lawyers Association of Michigan
resources.description: Provides support and networking opportunities for Black women in the legal profession, including mentorship and career development.
